channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Lamp post damaged causing potential dangerous situation, 22nd July
item.description:
A new lamp post is being damaged by a leaning Ash Tree that has been reported 4 times. This is a problem that was first identified 6 months ago and has subsequently deteriorated. It is situated on West Drive opposite Rose Cottage. The potential safety issues and unnecessary expense do not appear to be a concern!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): West Drive, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Ash Tree located on Highway land

item.title: Litter all along the edge of the carriageway, particularly heading west, 22nd July
item.description:
On the approach to Sainsbury's for a hundred metres there is littering all along the carriageway edge/verge. Large streams of plastic wrapping and other rubbish.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tewkesbury Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Old banner attached to street furniture on reservation, 22nd July
item.description:
Large, old banner, almost fallen off, attached to central reservation road furniture
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tewkesbury Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flyposting on central reservation on road furniture, 22nd July
item.description:
David Rodigan' flyposter attached to central reservatioin road furniture, just at the change of speed limit, near to Woodgate Close.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): London Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree very large and overhanging the cul de sac in Chase Avenue where cars are parks. Overhanging my next door neighbours garden. Risk of damage to gardens, cars and people due to falling branches, hazelnuts, leaves, sap., 22nd July
item.description:
At the back of 358 and 360 London Road in Chase Avenue. Next to the garage there which belongs to 360 London Road. The tree has now become very large with several trunks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 356b, London Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
